headline.print_headline: For N.F.L., Concussion Suits May Be Test for Sport Itself
headline.seo: N.F.L. Faces Retired Players in a High-Stakes Legal Battle
headline.main: For N.F.L., Concussion Suits May Be Test for Sport Itself

docs.abstract: Over a dozen lawsuits filed on behalf of more than 120 retired NFL players and their wives say that the league, and in some cases helmet manufacturers, deliberately concealed information about the neurological effects of repeated hits to the head; the flurry of lawsuits amount to a multifront legal challenge to the NFL league and to the game of football itself.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than a dozen suits say that the N.F.L. and in some cases helmet manufacturers deliberately concealed information about the neurological effects of repeated hits to the head.
docs.snippet: More than a dozen suits say that the N.F.L. and in some cases helmet manufacturers deliberately concealed information about the neurological effects of repeated hits to the head.
